title: pretzel_bikini
body:
A [[bikini]] top style where the top wraps around the wearer's neck like a [[halterneck]], then covers the front and wraps along the sides to connect both ends on the back.

The top often has a [[criss-cross halter]] front strap style to physically create this style. It's based on the [i]pretzel swimsuit[/i] style, originally for [[center opening|hollowed]] [[one-piece swimsuit|one-piece]] and/or [[slingshot swimsuit]]s.

This tag doesn't apply if there is a bridged strap on the bikini top.

title: pripara
body:
A Japanese arcade game by Takara Tomy. It is the successor of the [[Pretty Rhythm]] series of arcade games and the second entry in the [[Pretty Series]]. An anime television series adaptation, comprising three seasons, aired from 2014 to 2017. A second animation adaption, [[Idol Time PriPara]], premiered in 2017 and a mobile game, [[Idol Land PriPara]], was released in 2023 along with a web anime. PriPara also inspired four anime films. PriPara itself is succeeded by [[Kiratto Pri Chan]].

title: amane_kanata_(heavenly_guard_mission)
body:
The 8th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Amane Kanata]].

It's a [[policewoman]]-themed outfit consisting of a [[white hat|white]] [[peaked cap|peaked]] [[police hat]], a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[collared dress]] with a [[side slit]] and a [[white skirt|white]] [[quilted clothes|quilted]] [[miniskirt]] over it, a light [[blue necktie]], a [[chest harness]] with a [[walkie-talkie]] and [[belt pouch]]es hanging from it, a [[holstered]] magic [[gun]], [[white gloves|white]] [[partially fingerless gloves]] and [[white boots]] with [[colored shoe soles]]. She also an optional [[white jacket|white]] [[short-sleeved jacket]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[long hair]] in a [[one side up]] with [[crossed bangs|crossed]] [[double-parted bangs]] and [[sidelocks]], her hair also now has a [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient hair|gradient]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8869169: Profile (with jacket)
* !post #8869175: Profile (without jacket)
* !post #8867389: Merchandise

title: amane_kanata_(punk_rock)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Amane Kanata]]. It has a [[punk]] aesthetic.

It consist of a [[black jacket|black]] [[open jacket|open]]  [[hooded jacket]] with an [[animal hood]] and [[puffy long sleeves|puffy long]] [[detached sleeves]] reaching [[sleeves past fingers|past her fingers]] worn over a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]] with a [[print shirt|print]] of [[self character print|herself]] and a [[heart o-ring|heart]] [[o-ring harness|o-ring]] [[chest harness]] underneath, a [[black collar]], a [[single arm warmer]] with [[paint splatter]]s [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] with an [[o-ring thigh strap]] on her right leg and a regular thigh strap on her left, [[mismatched legwear]] (a [[fishnet pantyhose|fishnet]] [[single leg pantyhose]] with a [[black socks|black]] [[socks over pantyhose|sock over it]] on her right leg and a [[white socks|white]] [[single loose sock]] on her left) and [[black boots]] with a [[footwear bow|bow]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has [[medium hair|medium]]/[[long hair]] with long [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[sidelocks]], an [[ahoge]] and decorated with multiple [[hairclip]]s, including several [[x hair ornament|x-shaped]] ones and a [[bear hair ornament|bear-shaped]] one and an [[Upao (amane kanata)|]]-[[character hair ornament|shaped]] one.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6410423: Profile (with hoodie)
* !post #6410428: Profile (without hoodie)
other_names: 天音かなた(アタシは問題作)

title: amane_kanata_(nurse)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Amane Kanata]].

It is a [[nurse]] outfit consisting of a [[white hat|white]] [[nurse cap]] a [[white collar|white]] [[detached collar|detached]] [[wing collar]], a [[lanyard]] with a fake [[id card]] with Kanata's autograph, a [[grey dress]] or [[skirt set]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[white apron]] [[frilled apron]], [[bandaged arm]]s, [[white gloves]], a [[white pantyhose]], and [[grey shoes]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:

* [[Very long hair|Very long]] [[grey hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] & [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair|streaks]]
* [[Medium hair|Medium-length hair]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #5316942: Profile (short hair)
* !post #5316943: Profile (long hair)

title: amane_kanata_(work)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Amane Kanata]].

Named as her "work" outfit from [i]hololive Closet[/i], it consists of a [[white hat|white]] [[beret]] a [[short dress|short]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[black dress|black]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[pleated dress]] with a blue [[gradient dress|gradient]], a [[blue belt]], a [[white jacket]] with [[puffy long sleeves]], a [[star necklace|necklace with her signature shuriken halo]], [[black gloves|black]] [[partially fingerless gloves]], a [[thigh pouch]], [[uneven legwear|uneven]] [[mismatched legwear]] (a [[blue thighhighs|blue]] [[single thighhigh|thighhigh]] and a [[black socks|black]] [[single kneehigh|kneehigh]]) and [[white sneakers]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Long hair]] done in a [[two side up]] with a [[hairclip]]
* Long hair done in [[low twintails]] with [[hair rings]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #4638023: Profile (with jacket)
* !post #4638024: Profile (without jacket)
other_names: 天音かなた(お仕事衣装)

title: amane_kanata_(new_year)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Amane Kanata]].

It is a [[Wa Lolita]] New Years outfit, with a [[sleeveless]] [[kimono]] with a [[frills|frilly]] petticoat underneath and shoulder frills, secured with a frilled [[obi]] with lace and a large bow, itself decorated with her halo. She wears [[detached sleeves]] with frilly layers, ending with ribbon trim and decorated with knotwork. Her outfit is primarily white and [[blue kimono|blue]], with pink as an accent color.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her [[short hair]] done in a [[single side bun]], with [[hairclip]]s and a [[braid]]. Additionally, she also has [[hamster ears]] with this outfit.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4542513: Profile

title: amane_kanata_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Amane Kanata]].

It consists of a [[grey jacket|grey]] [[cropped jacket]] with [[long sleeves|long]], [[wide sleeves]] going with [[sleeve cuffs]] [[sleeves past wrists|past her wrists]] with [[aiguillette]]s and a [[white sailor collar]], worn over a [[white shirt]] and a black turtleneck dress (although it's often depicted as just a separate [[turtleneck]] shirt and [[black skirt|black]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[miniskirt]]), a [[blue bowtie]], a yellow [[armband]], [[blue socks|blue]] [[gingham socks|gingham]] [[kneehighs]] held up with [[legwear garter]]s and [[black boots]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3931917: Profile
* !post #4428227: Reference sheet
* !post #8203052: Merchandise

title: rindo_chihaya
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] and member of of [[hololive DEV_IS]]' second group [[FLOW GLOW (hololive)|]]. Designed by [[toridamono]].

She has [[red eyes]], [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] with [[aqua hair|aqua]], [[purple hair|purple]] and [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and aqua [[colored inner hair]].

Her default hairstyle consists of [[swept bangs|swept]] [[asymmetrical bangs|asymmetrical]] [[braided bangs]] and [[sidelocks]].

Her default costume, consists of a [[black hat|black]] [[spiked hat|spiked]] [[beret]], a [[black choker]] with a steering wheel pendant [[headphones around neck|headphones around her neck]], a [[long shirt|long]] [[black shirt|black]] [[off-shoulder shirt]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[raglan sleeves]], worn over a [[white tank top]] and [[purple shorts]] a black [[o-ring thigh strap]] on her right leg and a [[knee strap]] on her left,  [[black socks|black]] [[spiked socks|spiked]] [[loose socks]] and [[black sneakers|black]] [[high tops]]. She also wears [[multiple rings|multiple]] [[skull ring]]s and has [[steering wheel]]-shaped [[earrings]].

h4. Costumes

* !post #8398042: Default

h4. External links

* "YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/@RindoChihaya
* "Twitter":https://x.com/rindochihaya

title: basculegion
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0902 in the National Pokédex, a Water/Ghost-type.

A [[fish]]-like Pokémon with a grey body and [[sharp teeth]]. Its male variant has and pink accents and [[pink eyes]], while its female variant has white accents and [[white eyes]].

Evolves from [[basculin_(white)|White-Striped]] [[Basculin]].

Japanese name: [b]Idaitou[/b]

body:

It's a [[gothic lolita]] outfit consisting of a [[black choker|black]] [[lace choker]] with a [[brooch]], an [[asymmetrical dress|asymmetrical]] [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[green dress]] with [[long sleeves]], [[black gloves]], optional black [[capelet]] with a [[Yatagarasu]] print, [[white thighhighs]], and [[black shoes]] [[high heels]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #6671808: Profile
* !post #6682202: Reference sheet

title: ichijou_ririka_(regloss_uniform)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive DEV_IS]]' [[Ichijou Ririka]], her version of the [[ReGLOSS (hololive)|]] unit costume.

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[cropped shirt]] with a [[single sleeve]] [[long sleeves|long sleeve]], [[white pants|white]] [[cargo pants]], a [[black belt]], and [[white boots]].
For her, [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her hair done in a [[two side up]], along with a [[single earring|single]] [[heart earrings|heart earring]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6654416: Profile

title: ichijou_ririka_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive DEV_IS]]'s [[Ichijou Ririka]]. 

She wears a [[white jacket|white]] [[fur jacket]] worn over a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[blouse]] with [[center frills]] (which is [[shirt tucked in|tucked in]]), a [[purple skirt|purple]] [[pencil skirt|pencil]] [[miniskirt]], and a pair of [[black boots|black]] [[high heel boots]]. Her accessories include  a [[white belt]], a [[thigh strap]], a [[gold choker]], a [[wristwatch]], and a pair of [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear on head|on top of her head]].

title: otonose_kanade_(regloss_uniform)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive DEV_IS]]' [[Otonose Kanade]], her version of the [[ReGLOSS (hololive)|]] unit costume.

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] and [[shoulder cutout]], which is [[shirt tucked in|tucked underneath]] a pair of [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]]. She also wears a [[red bowtie]], a [[thigh pouch]], an [[uneven legwear|uneven]] pair of [[white socks]] (one ankle-height and [[single over-kneehigh|one over-kneeheight]]), and [[grey boots]].
Fo her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she now wears hair in a [[side ponytail]].

body:

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[pink hair]] with [[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] tied into [[twintails]] held together with a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]], she also has [[blue eyes]].

title: nerissa_ravencroft_(new_year)
body:
The 2nd/New Year [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Nerissa Ravencroft]].

It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[frilled choker]], a [[black kimono|black]] [[feather-trimmed kimono|feather-trimmed]] [[furisode]] with a  [[floral print kimono|floral]] [[floral print|print]] [[print kimono|theme]] and [[wide sleeves]] with a [[feather print]] giving the impression of wings, a [[white scarf]] [[fur scarf]], a [[black shawl]] with [[feather-trimmed shawl|feather]] and [[lace-trimmed shawl|lace trim]], [[black gloves|black]] [[lace gloves]], [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]] and [[black sandals|black]] [[geta]]. She also has a [[single earring|single]] [[flower knot]] [[tassel earrings|tassel earring]] and an optional [[blue umbrella|blue]] [[oil-paper umbrella]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this attire is [[medium hair|medium]]/[[long hair]] in a [[single hair bun]] with [[blue hair]] [[streaked hair]], [[sidelocks]] [[french braid]]s and [[sidelocks]], decorated with [[hair flower]]s and multiple [[hairclip]]s. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7062514: Profile
other_names: ネリッサ・レイヴンクロフト(正月衣装)

title: himekawa_yoshino
body:
A character from [[Date A Live]].

In the series, Yoshino is the second of the appearing spirits. A shy person, she uses a [[hand puppet]] named "[[Yoshinon]]" to speak for her. Her abilities revolve around the control of water in the 3 classical states, but prefers ice in combat.

title: mikami_chiori
body:
An unlockable character from [[Mahjong Soul]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]]. Her eyes are [[blue eyes|blue]].

Chiori was born to a rich family in Tokyo. Her father is a university professor and her mother is a surgeon. They are often traveling for work and leave a maid to take care of Chiori most of the time. One year, she received a teddy bear bag from her parents as het birthday present, and she keeps it with her all the time. She learned about mahjong from a TV show and fell in love with the game. "Mahjong is so fun! I can have so much from other people's suffering."

h4. Appearance

* !post #5198055

title: kill_markings
body: A type of [[tally]] marking, usually done on the side of a [[vehicle]] or [[weapon]], to boast about the number of enemies killed by said vehicle or weapon. Examples can include painted [[flag]]s on the side of an aircraft down to notches carved into the stock of a gun.

title: guild_no_uketsukejou_desu_ga_zangyou_wa_iya_nanode_boss_wo_solo_toubatsu_shiyou_to_omoimasu
body:
A fantasy light novel written by "Kousaka Mato":[https://x.com/mato52242844] (香坂マト) and illustrated by [[Gaou (umaiyo puyoman)|]] about... a guild receptionist who would solo any boss to clock out on time.

title: pokemon_go
body:
A mobile app created by Niantic, Inc. and the Pokemon Company. Players take their smartphones with them, walk around, and catch [[Pokemon]], just like in the main series. The game initially included Generation I Pokemon, but began adding Generation II Pokemon in early 2017 and Generation III during the same year's Halloween event.

The game is often set as an example of a "flavor of the month" fad. Its online popularity dropped drastically a few months after its release; many blame this on the lack of updates and content on launch, Niantic, Inc.'s poor management and playerbase communication, and its freemium pay-to-win system prevalent in many other mobile games. However, despite the decrease in internet activity, it's still a popular game, and some cite the game and the release of [i][[pokemon sm|Pokemon Sun and Moon]][/i] as the causes of a resurgence in franchise popularity overall. More features being added over the course of 2017 have also drawn back some of the initial fans that dropped off for the above reasons.

On March 12, 2025, Niantic sold Pokemon GO to Scopely, the makers of Monopoly Go!.

h4. Characters

* [[Male Protagonist (Pokemon GO)|]]
* [[Female Protagonist (Pokemon GO)|]]
* [[willow_(pokemon)|Professor Willow]]
* [[Candela (Pokemon)|]]
* [[Blanche (Pokemon)|]]
* [[Spark (Pokemon)|]]
* Team GO Rocket
** [[Arlo (pokemon)|]]
** [[Cliff (pokemon)|]]
** [[Sierra (pokemon)|]]

h4. External links

* "Google Play Store: Pokemon GO":https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.nianticlabs.pokemongo&hl=en
* "iOS App Store: Pokemon GO":https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/pokemon-go/id1094591345?mt=8

title: mature_female
body:
An attractive "middle-aged" woman. Common traits include slight [[mature eyes|face]] [[wrinkled skin|wrinkles]], a noticeable [[belly]], and an overall body shape that's generally [[curvy|curvier]] than that of a younger woman. Alternate terms, depending on age range, can include cougar, hag, or MILF ([b]M[/b]other [b]I[/b]'d [b]L[/b]ike to [b]F[/b]uck; used regardless of the fact whether she's had children or not).

A woman that is said to be a mother or shown with her own children does not automatically make her a mature female. She must [i]look[/i] like an older woman to count.

h4. Examples

* !post #6015611
* !post #7870493

title: nerissa_ravencroft_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Nerissa Ravencroft]].

It consists of a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt|white]] [[ribbed shirt|ribbed]] [[dress shirt]] with [[shoulder cutout]]s and [[long sleeves]], an open [[black bowtie]], a black [[waistcoat]] with [[coattails]] with an [[breast strap]] and [[underbust]] [[belt]]s wiving a [[framed breasts]] effect, a [[black jacket|black]] [[feather-trimmed jacket|feather-trimmed]] jacket [[off shoulder|typically worn hanging off her arms]] with [[feather-trimmed sleeves]], [[black gloves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt|pencil]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[side slit]], a [[layered skirt|layered]] [[half-skirt|half]] [[overskirt]] with an outer white layer styled after a wing and a blue inner layer, [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] and [[uneven legwear]] (a [[black pantyhose|black]] [[single leg pantyhose|single-leg]] [[argyle pantyhose]] on one leg and a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black]] [[o-ring legwear|o-ring]] [[print thighhighs|print thighhigh]] with  a [[single garter strap|garter strap]] and an [[o-ring thigh strap]] on the other and [[black footwear|black]] [[pumps]]. She also carries a long [[microphone]] that can transform into a [[bident]].

h4. Appearance

title: goomba
body:
[b]Goomba[/b], also known as [b]Kuriboh[/b] in the Japanese version, is a race of creatures from the [[Mario_(series)|Super Mario]] video games. They are primarily serving as one of the most common enemies in the game, along with [[Koopa Troopa]].

Typically appeared as a creature with short, brown, [[mushroom]]-like body with a small feet and [[no arms]].

Not to be confused with the [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] monster known as [[Kuriboh]].

h4. Official art

* !post #6102023

* "Super Mario Wiki: Goomba":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Goomba]

title: sun_wukong
body:
Sun Wukong (孫 悟空 / 孙 悟空, [i]Sūn Wùkōng[/i], also known as The Monkey King in English and [i]Son Gokū[/i] in Japanese) is a character from the classical Chinese novel [[Journey to the West]]. He has been depicted in many different ways over the years.

His most notable weapon is the size-changing staff [[Ruyi Jingu Bang]], which also has its own various depictions in popular culture.

title: kaela_kovalskia_(new_year)
body:
The 2nd/New Year [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[Kaela Kovalskia]].

It consists of a [[short kimono|short]] [[black kimono|black]] [[sleeveless kimono]] with [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves]], an optional [[see-through kimono layer|layer]] and [[feather boa]], a [[white_sash|white]] [[obi]], and [[black boots|black]] [[ankle boots]] styled after [[tengu-geta]]. She also carries a [[kiseru]] and has an optional [[gorilla mask]] [[mask on head|on her head]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[Short hair|Short]] [[wavy hair]] with [[sidelocks]]
* [[Very long hair|Very low]] [[low-tied long hair|low-tied hair]] tied in [[low twintails]] with long [[sidelocks]]

Both versions are decorated with a red [[kanzashi]]

h4. Appearance

title: miku_day
body:
Works created to celebrate [[Vocaloid]] [[Hatsune Miku]] on March 9th (3/9), also known as Miku Day. Often includes a reference to the [[dated|date]] somewhere in the image.

The number [[39]] is a [[number pun]] on both "Thank You" and "Miku" in Japanese.

This tag was previously named [[MikuPa]] in reference to "Hatsune [b]Miku[/b]'s Live [b]Pa[/b]rty", a yearly event held on 3/9 from 2011 to 2013 where [[SEGA]] and its affiliates put on a giant concert in Tokyo starring Miku.

h4. See also 

* [[Zaku Day]]

title: tsunomaki_watame_(1st_solo_live)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Tsunomaki Watame]], debuted during her first solo 3D concert [i]Watame Night Fever!! in Zepp Tokyo[/i].

It consists of a [[red choker|red]] [[frilled choker]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[cross-laced top|cross-laced]] [[halter shirt]] with a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] section on her [[see-through midriff|midriff area]], [[red sleeves|red]] [[fur-trimmed sleeves|fur-trimmed]] [[puffy detached sleeves|detached]] [[puffy short sleeves]], fur-trimmed [[wrist cuffs]], a [[single glove|single]] [[red gloves|red glove]], a [[layered skirt]] consisting of a [[see-through skirt|see-through]] [[overskirt]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[half-skirt|half]] [[miniskirt]] and a [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[black skirt|black]]/[[grey skirt|dark grey]] [[pleated skirt]] [[high-low skirt]], a red [[thigh strap]], a black [[ankle strap]] and [[black boots|black]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[ankle boots]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is very similar to her regular hairstyle except she has [[braided bangs]] and the hair on the sides is tied into a [[two side up]] instead of her usual half-updo.

title: utau
body:
UTAU is a free singing synthesizer program that was developed to use wave files that could be put together to simulate singing. UTAU is best known for letting people create their own voice banks by the use of their own voice. 

The UTAU voice banks are often personified into characters called UTAUloids. This became popular after [[Kasane Teto]], a former [[VOCALOID]] joke character, became known as an UTAU. 

[b]UTAU isn't [[VOCALOID]][/b] and shouldn't be confused with or tagged as such (and vice versa).

title: welcome_mat
body:
A specific type of [[doormat]] designed with a greeting or decorative elements to express hospitality to visitors. While it serves the same functional purpose as a regular doormat (cleaning shoes before entering), a welcome mat has the additional role of creating a warm, inviting atmosphere.

Welcome mats typically:

* Feature phrases like "Welcome," "Hello," or "Come In"
* Often have decorative designs or images
* Are placed at the main entrance to a home or building
* Symbolize hospitality and openness to guests

Many people choose welcome mats that reflect their personality or home décor style, making them both a practical item and a first impression of the household's character.

title: doormat
body:
A small mat or rug placed at the entrance of a home or building, typically just outside or inside the door. Its main purpose is functional - it allows people to wipe dirt, mud, snow, or moisture from their shoes before entering, helping keep interior floors clean.

While "[[welcome mat]]" often emphasizes hospitality with welcoming messages, "doormat" is a more general term that can refer to any mat at a doorway, regardless of design or message.

title: sleep_mask
body:
A lightweight fabric covering designed to be worn over the eyes during sleep or rest. Its primary purpose is to block out light, creating darkness that can help promote better sleep quality.

Sleep masks typically feature:
* Soft, comfortable materials like silk, cotton, or foam
* An elastic band that goes around the head to keep it in place
* A contoured design that fits over the eyes without putting pressure on them

People use sleep masks when traveling (especially on planes), working night shifts, or in bedrooms that aren't fully dark. They're also helpful for those sensitive to light while sleeping or for maintaining consistent sleep patterns.

title: flats
body:
A style of footwear characterized by having little to no heel (typically less than half an inch in height). They are essentially the opposite of [[high heels]]. They're popular for their comfort and versatility and come in various styles:

* [b]Ballet flats[/b]: Inspired by [[ballet slippers]] with a rounded toe and simple design.
* [b][[Loafers]][/b]: Structured slip-on shoes.
* [b]Oxford flats[/b]: Laced shoes with a flat sole.
* [b]Pointed-toe flats[/b]: Similar to ballet flats but with a pointed toe.
* [b][[Mary Janes]][/b]: Flats with a strap across the instep.

Flats are commonly worn in casual, professional, and formal settings. They're especially popular as a comfortable alternative to high heels while still maintaining a polished appearance. They can be made from various materials including [[leather]], suede, canvas, and synthetic fabrics.

title: boat_shoes
body:
[[Boat]] [[shoes]]—sometimes called deck shoes—are casual footwear originally designed for boating and other activities on or around the [[water]]. Their defining features include:

* [b]Non-Marking Soles[/b]: Boat shoes typically have soft, rubber soles with a siped (finely grooved) pattern. These grooves help channel water away, improving traction on wet surfaces without leaving marks on the deck.

* [b]Water-Resistant Uppers[/b]: Most boat shoes are made from treated [[leather]] or canvas to repel water and reduce staining. The low-cut design also facilitates quick drying and makes them easy to slip on and off.

* [b]Classic Lacing System[/b]: Many boat shoes use a 360-degree rawhide lace that surrounds the heel, allowing for a snug, adjustable fit.

* [b]Origins and Brand Associations[/b]: They were popularized by Sperry (specifically, the Sperry Top-Sider) in the 1930s. Paul Sperry is credited with developing the first modern boat shoe after noticing his [[dog]]’s ability to run on ice without slipping—leading him to invent the siped sole.

Today, boat shoes have transcended their maritime roots and are worn as stylish, casual footwear on and off the water. Their timeless look pairs well with [[shorts]], [[jeans]], and other laid-back outfits, making them a popular warm-weather staple.

title: door_chain
body:
A door chain or security chain is a small [[chain]] affixed to the door frame that attaches to a track on the door.  This is to prevent the door from being opened completely as a security measure, while allowing the door to be opened enough to communicate or exchange small items with a person outside.  These are a common feature on hotel and motel room doors.

h4. External Link

* "Wikipedia - Door Chain":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Door_chain]

title: qr_code
body:
A QR (Quick Response) Code is a matrix barcode readable by QR scanners, [[cellphone|mobile phone]]s with a camera, and smartphones. The code consists of black modules arranged in a square pattern on a white background. Although in theory anything can be encoded, the most common application is to encode a URL so that anyone with a smartphone can load a Website by taking a picture.

h4. See also

* [[barcode]]
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/QR_Code
* "ZXing online decoder":http://zxing.org/w/decode.jspx
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

title: light_switch
body: A simple electrical device used to control a light fixture by opening or closing the circuit that powers it. When the switch is on, the circuit is closed and electricity flows, allowing the light to turn on. When the switch is off, the circuit is opened, interrupting the power supply and turning the light off. Light switches are commonly found on walls, near room entrances, and can come in various styles (e.g., toggle, rocker, push-button) to suit different design preferences and functional requirements.

h4. Permissions

h6. Restricted users

* Can't edit anything until they verify their email address. A user is restricted if they signup using a VPN or proxy.

h6. Members and above can:

* Upload posts (subject to their [[about:upload limits|upload limit]]).
* Favorite and vote on posts.
* Edit posts and tags.
* Flag posts (up to 5 per 3 days).
* Appeal posts (each appeal costs 3 upload slots).
* Create and edit pools.
* Create, edit, and delete wiki pages and artist entries.
* Create, edit, and delete their own comments and forum posts.
* Change the category of tags with less than 50 posts.
* Create, reject, and edit their own [[help:bulk_update_requests|Bulk Update Requests]].
* Send and receive DMails.
* Edit their user settings.
* Change their username (at most once a week).
* View username change history.

h6. Gold and above can:

* Create [[help:user records|feedbacks]] to other users
* Use the "mode menu":[/wiki_pages/help:posts#dtext-mode-menu] in the sidebar for quicker tagging, favoriting, and upvoting.
* Have private favorites, favgroups, and upvotes.
* View the forum activity indicator. The "Forum" link in the navbar will become italicized when there are unread posts.

h6. Builders and above can:

* Lock and unlock wiki pages.
* Delete and undelete pools.
* Change the category of any tag with less than 1000 posts.
* Approve alias and rename [[help:bulk update requests|bulk update requests]] for artist tags under 200 posts.

h6. Contributors and above can:

* Upload an unlimited amount of posts without being subject to the [[about:mod queue|moderation queue]] (their posts are automatically approved). Posts can still voluntarily be sent through the modqueue.
* Appeal an unlimited number of posts.

h6. Approvers and above can:

* Approve and undelete posts (excluding their own uploads and posts they previously approved).
* Delete posts.
* Move favorites from deleted posts to their parent post.
* Ban and unban posts.
* Flag posts without limit.

h6. Moderators and above can:

* Promote or demote users (up to Approver level).
* View the IP and session history of other users.
* Ban users, IP addresses, and IP ranges.
* Change the name of other users (Builder and below).
* Edit or delete user feedbacks (except ones given to them).
* View who voted on comments.
* View or search who flagged a post (except on their own uploads).
* Replace the image on a post with a different file.
* Edit, delete, or sticky (prevent hiding due to downvotes) comments.
* Edit or delete forum posts.
* Delete, pin, or lock/unlock forum threads.

h6. Admins can:

* Promote or demote users (up to Moderator level).
* Approve, edit, or reject bulk update requests.
* Expunge (permanently delete from the site) posts.
* Change the category of any tag.
* View who voted on posts.
* Ban or unban artist tags.
* Approve any post any number of times.
* Create site news banners.

h4#getting-promoted. Getting promoted

* [b]Member[/b] - Anyone can "sign up":/users/new for a free member account.
* [s][b]Gold[/b] - "Buy an account upgrade for $20":[/user_upgrades/new] (one-time fee)[/s] | Currently unavailable. See topic #21157.
* [s][b]Platinum[/b] - "Buy an account upgrade for $40":[/user_upgrades/new][/s] | No longer available for upgrade.

To advance to a higher user level, you must be promoted by a Moderator or Admin. The following are general guidelines on how to get promoted:

* [b]Builder[/b] - Make a large number of improvements to the site, such as by uploading, translating, tagging, contributing to forum discussions or anything else that is helpful to other users.
* [b]Contributor[/b] - Contribute a large number of high-quality uploads. It is important to have few deleted uploads (the usual case is under 5% of the total uploads submitted in the last few months).
* [b]Approver[/b] - Have an excellent record of high quality uploads, with very few deleted. Approver promotions typically happen a few times a year, depending on the overall size of the [[about:mod_queue|modqueue]] and the number of currently active approvers, and only a handful of users are picked each time.

title: pull_string
body:
A short cord, rope, or string attached to a mechanism that activates or operates something when it is pulled. You’ll see them in various applications:

* [b]Toys[/b]: In “pull-string” dolls or toys, pulling the string winds a small internal mechanism (often a spring-loaded recorder or gear system) that plays a sound or makes the toy move. Classic talking dolls, for example, will say phrases when you pull the string.
* [b]Tools and Equipment[/b]: Some lawnmowers and generators have a pull-cord starter that you yank to ignite the engine. The string (or cord) is attached to a recoil mechanism that spins the engine shaft, helping it start.
* [b]Household Items[/b]: Items like blinds or ceiling fans sometimes have a pull-string or pull-cord that toggles lights or adjusts the window covering.

The essential idea is that the tension from pulling on the string causes an internal mechanism or motor to engage, producing movement, sound, or another form of action.

title: yoke_(clothing)
body:
A shaped piece of fabric that is sewn to the upper portion of a garment, typically over the shoulders and chest/back. It serves to provide shape, improve fit, control fullness, and can also be a significant design element. Think of it as the "shoulder and upper chest/back area" of a garment being constructed as a separate, often shaped, piece rather than just a continuation of the main body fabric.

Very popular in the western wear of [[cowboy]]s and [[cowgirl (western)|cowgirls]].

title: baseboard
body:
A functional and decorative element that is an essential part of interior finishing, it is the decorative strip that sits at the very bottom of a walls covering the junction where the wall and floor come together. It serves to protect walls, conceal imperfections, and add visual appeal to a room.

In some regions, baseboards might be called "skirting boards," "skirting," "wainscoting," "mopboard," "trim," "floor molding," or "base molding."

title: fantastic_four_(2015)
body:
[b]Fantastic Four[/b] (stylized as [b]FANT4STIC[/b]) is a 2015 superhero film based on the [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]] [[Fantastic Four|team of the same name]]. Directed by Josh Trank, who co-wrote the screenplay with Jeremy Slater and Simon Kinberg, it stars Miles Teller, Michael B. Jordan, Kate Mara, Jamie Bell and Toby Kebbell. The film follows a group of intelligent teenagers who build a transdimensional portal, causing them to gain superhuman abilities.

Fantastic Four premiered at Williamsburg Cinemas in New York City on August 4, 2015, and was released on August 7 in the United States. The film received negative reviews from critics and was considered a box-office bomb, grossing $167.9 million worldwide against a production budget of $120 million, with an estimated loss between $80–$100 million for the studio. Fantastic Four received several Golden Raspberry Awards, including Worst Director and Worst Picture. Trank also voiced his displeasure with the final film, which he attributed to production studio [[20th Century Studios|20th Century Fox]]'s interference.

title: anya_(spy_x_family)
body:
One of the three main characters of [[Spy x Family]].

She is a young girl who is a former experimental subject, granting [[mind reading]] abilities. 'Adopted' by [[Twilight (spy x family)|]] as part of the latter's cover identity. As such, she is also the adoptive 'stepdaughter' of [[Yor Briar]]. Can be seen with plushies, such as [[Director Chimera (spy x family)|]] and Agent Penguinman.

Has [[pink hair]] with [[hairpods]] covering [[cone hair bun]]s.

She is voiced by [[Tanezaki Atsumi]] in Japanese and Megan Shipman in English.

h4. Other names

* [b]Anya Forger:[/b] Assumed 'legal name' after being adopted by 'Loid Forger'.
* [b]Subject 007:[/b] Her 'name' during her experimental subject days.
* [b]Anya Folger:[/b] Transliteration used in some of the earlier official English translations.
* [b]Ania:[/b] Name as spelled in the original Japanese series, on occasions when Latin letter script is used. Short Mission 11 has Loid correcting her and changing it to 'Anya', to her surprise. Also name used in some of the earlier official English translations. Polish variant of "Anna"/"Anya".

h4. See also

* [[Anya's heh face (meme)]]
* [[wakuwaku (spy x family)|]]

title: eve_(stellar_blade)
body:
Main character from [[Stellar Blade]]. Her name is stylized as "EVE".

A commando of the 7th Airborne Division of the Space Colony. Eve was sent to Earth in a combat mission against Earthlings, but her entire unit was wiped out. She was saved by [[Adam (Stellar Blade)|]], and began her journey to adapt and survive in her new home.

EVE is a [[tall female|tall woman]] with a [[long legs]], [[medium breasts|medium]] to [[large breasts]] (depending on costume she's wearing), [[brown eyes]] and [[black hair]]. Her default hairstyle is a [[very long hair|very long]] [[ponytail]] with [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[medium bangs]], though the player can change it in the options menu. She has various small [[mole]]s across her body and face. Her default outfit is a [[Planet Diving Suit (7th) (Stellar Blade)|]]. She also wears different types of heels depending on the outfit the player chooses. Her [[sword]] [[Blood Edge (Stellar Blade)|]] folds up and functions as a [[hairclip]] for her ponytail when not in use.

h4. Official art

* !post #8640908: Profile

* [[Skin suit (Stellar Blade)|]]

title: silent_hill_2_(remake)
body: Silent Hill 2 is a 2024 survival horror game developed by Bloober Team and published by Konami Digital Entertainment. It is a remake of the 2001 video game [[Silent Hill 2]], originally developed by Team Silent, a group within Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo (KCET). It is the first major installment in the [[Silent Hill (series)|Silent Hill series]] since [[Silent Hill: Downpour]] (2012). Like the original game, it follows [[James Sunderland]], a widower, who returns to the eponymous town in Maine upon receiving a letter from his deceased wife, Mary, who claims to be waiting there for him.

title: ultra_slash

title: general_grievous
body:
General Grievous is a character in the [[Star Wars]] franchise, he was introduced in the 2003 animated series [[Star Wars: Clone Wars]] (voiced by John DiMaggio in the second season and Richard McGonagle in the third season), before appearing through computer-generated imagery in the 2005 live-action film [[star wars: revenge of the sith| Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith]] (voiced by Matthew Wood). Wood reprised the role in the 2008 animated series [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]] and the 2024 anthology series Tales of the Empire.

Grievous is depicted as a brilliant military strategist who serves as the Supreme Commander of the Confederacy of Independent Systems' Droid Armies during the Clone Wars. He is a powerful Kaleesh cyborg who has mastered all forms of lightsaber combat, under the tutelage of [[Count Dooku]], to rival the Force abilities of the Jedi of the Galactic Republic. Grievous harbors an intense hatred of the Jedi, and gains a reputation as a feared and ruthless Jedi hunter who collects the lightsabers of his fallen victims as trophies. He develops a rivalry with [[Jedi]] Master [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]], whom he clashes with several times during the war, and is killed by Kenobi during their final confrontation in Revenge of the Sith.

title: spot_the_differences
body:
A visual puzzle which features two almost identical illustrations. The object is to find the differences between the two. Some of the differences are very obvious while others are so subtle one has to carefully examine the illustrations to find them.

In the case of Danbooru, the puzzle would consist of the two illustrations being in the same post or across parent-and-child posts, sometimes with solutions on a separate post.

title: jump_king
body:
A 2019 platforming game developed by Nexile and first released in May 2019.

The player, who controls the titular [[Jump King (character)|]], must make precise upward jumps in order to reach the "smoking hot [[babe (jump king)|]]" at the top, and one wrong jump can send the player a long way down. The game's sheer difficulty has made it popular among streamers and speedrunners, much like [[Getting Over It]].

title: kashuu_kiyomitsu
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. One of the five starter swords the player can choose when beginning the game.

Both he and [[Yamato-no-Kami Yasusada]] are personifications of swords owned by [[Okita Souji]]. When he took the sword into battle in the Ikedaya Incident, Kiyomitsu's tip was broken off during the battle and deemed irreparable, so Okita abandoned him. Kiyomitsu cares a lot about his appearance and thinks looking beautiful will earn him the [[saniwa_(touken_ranbu)|Saniwa]]'s love and avoid being abandoned again. 

He has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] worn in a [[ponytail]], [[red eyes]], and a [[mole under mouth|mole under his lip]]. His standard outfit is a [[red scarf]], [[earrings]], a black [[coat]], [[black pants]], [[high_heel_boots|high-heeled boots]] and red [[nail polish]].

His frequent demands for attention from the Saniwa has led to him being portrayed in doujins as being "protago-sexual", falling in love with anyone who is the protagonist of a series, whatever kind of saniwa (male or female, kind or mean, good or evil...).

He and Yamato-no-kami are the main focus of [i][[Touken Ranbu: Hanamaru]][/i].

title: yamanbagiri_kunihiro
body:
Male personification of the sword [i]Yamanbagiri[/i] crafted by Horikawa Kunihiro. One of the five starter swords in [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i]. Uchigatana-class.

The sword he is based on is actually a replica, as Nagao Akinaga, the lord of Ashikaga castle, requested a copy of the original [i]Yamanbagiri[/i]. In the game, this fact manifests itself in a massive inferiority complex concerning his replica status, and repeatedly devalues himself as a member of the saniwa's group. His happier lines are when he's doing fieldwork, as he feels that those are the only times where he can't be compared to the original [i]Yamanbagiri[/i]. Despite his negative self-opinion, he asserts himself as Kunihiro's "masterpiece".

Has [[blonde hair]] and [[aqua eyes]]. Wears a white [[hooded cloak]] and a [[open jacket]]ed [[suit]] with a [[blue necktie]]. By default, his clothes are somewhat [[torn_clothes|torn]]. His casual outfit is a red [[track suit]], and he still wears his cloak over it.

Seiyuu is Maeno Tomoaki. Character design is done by [[toichi (ik07)|Toichi]].

title: mutsu-no-kami_yoshiyuki
body:
A [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] character. Personification of the sword [i]Mutsu-no-kami[/i], a  sword that belonged to the historical figure [[Sakamoto Ryouma]].

He's one of the five swords the player can choose at the start of the game, along with [[Kashuu Kiyomitsu]], [[Kasen Kanesada]], [[Yamanbagiri Kunihiro]], and [[Hachisuka Kotetsu]].


He holds the distinction of being the only sword that carries a [[gun]] on his person, referencing the fact that the time period in which the actual sword was smithed was a time of changing war tactics, including the gun becoming more commonly used than the sword. He holds no grudges over this however. Along with this, he seems very interested in modern technology in general. 

He butts heads often with [[Izumi-no-Kami Kanesada]], due to their owners being on opposite sides in the Bakumatsu era. Both, however, have top billing in [i][[Katsugeki/Touken Ranbu]][/i].

He has slightly messy [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]], and [[brown eyes]]. Normal clothes consist of [[japanese clothes]] with a [[sarashi]], [[igote]] and [[kote]] on the left arm, and [[sandals]]. Casual clothes give him a [[bandana]] with [[seigaiha]].

title: selia
body:
A popular OC daughter between [[Seliph_(fire_emblem)|Seliph]] and [[larcei_(fire_emblem)|Larcei]] from [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]]

Has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with [[short_hair_with_long_locks|long sidelocks]], and often seen wearing a [[white_headband|white]] [[headband]], and a [[blue shirt]] with a [[pelvic curtain]].
Her design carries the attributes of both her parents.

Created by "@MrTalkingDino":[https://x.com/MrTalkingDino] and "@WhiteBloodGames":[https://twitter.com/WhiteBloodGames].

title: hunting
body:
Humans and other humanoid characters hunting animals with the use of weapons for food or for sport.

For animals naturally hunting other animals for food, see [[predation]].

title: feral_instincts
body:
An animal-like character (such as a [[monster girl]], [[furry]] or kemonomimi) exhibiting behavior from the animal they're based on. For example, a [[cat girl]] grooming themselves or playing with cat toys, or a [[dog girl]] playing fetch.

Should not be used for actual animals.

title: dominica_s._gentile
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Kurenai no Majo-tachi]]

A Flight Lieutenant from Liberion serving in the [[504th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Called the "One-man Air Force", she's in a relationship with [[Jane T. Godfrey]] whom she calls her wife, and who in turn calls her "boss" or "don".
Her familiar is the eagle, her weapons are the M1919A6 machine gun, the Colt M1917 revolver, the Thompson M1A1 sub-machine gun. and the M1911 Pistol. She's based on Don Gentile.
other_names: ドミニカ・S・ジェンタイル

title: deep_impact_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]As in a "strong impression". Unrelated to the 1998 disaster movie.[/tn]

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Wind in Her Hair. A bay horse with a small, irregularly-shaped star marking and socks on all but the front left leg.

The first undefeated Japanese Triple Crown winner since [[Symboli Rudolf (racehorse)|]] and a winner of 7 G1 races. He is also Sunday Silence's successor as Japan's leading sire (2012-2022), with [b][i]61[/i][/b] G1-winning progeny and at least a single classics winner in every eligible generation (Japan or Overseas, from 2011 to 2023), from Marcelina (2011 Oka Sho) to Auguste Rodin (2023 Epsom Derby and Irish Derby). He also produced a Triple Tiara and a Triple Crown ([[Gentildonna (racehorse)|]] and [[Contrail (racehorse)|]] in 2012 and 2020 respectively.)

Thus, not only he made a "deep impact" on the racetrack, his "ejecta" caused even more damage.

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], the real life [i]Deep Impact[/i] was an obvious short-lister for the franchise, having made [[deep impact (umamusume)|a tentative appearance]] in the early days of the franchise. However, due to the controversy arising from the franchise's bastardization of [[King Kamehameha (umamusume)|]] (which share the same owner, the Kaneko stable), he and other horse from the Kaneko stable are unlikely to officially appear.

So far, seven of his progeny appears in the franchise: [[Satono Diamond (umamusume)|]] (2016 Kikuka Sho, Arima Kinen), [[Verxina (umamusume)|]] (2nd place in all Triple Tiara races in 2012; 2013, 2014 Victoria Mile), [[Vivlos (umamusume)|]] (2016 Shuka Sho, 2017 Dubai Turf), [[Gentildonna (umamusume)|]] (2012 Triple Tiara, 2012, 2013 Japan Cup, 2014 Dubai Sheema, 2014 Arima Kinen), [[Gran Alegria (umamusume)|]] (2019 Oka Sho, 2020, 2021 Mile Championship, 2020 Yasuda Kinen, 2020 Sprinters Stakes, 2021 Victoria Mile), [[Loves Only You (umamusume)|]] (2019 Oaks, 2021 QEII Cup, HK Cup, BC Filly & Mare Turf) and [[Curren Bouquetd'or (umamusume)|]] (No G1s, 2019 Sweetpea Stakes (Listed), 2nd in 2019 Oaks, Shuka Sho and Japan Cup).

title: reisen_udongein_inaba
body:
The "Lunatic [[Moon Rabbit]]". Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Imperishable Night]] and later a recurring playable character in games.

Pet lunar [[rabbit girl|rabbit]] of [[Houraisan Kaguya]], apprentice to [[Yagokoro Eirin]], and caretaker of earth-born rabbit youkai [[Inaba Tewi]]. Her power is to cause lunacy with her stare, as well as control all kinds of wavelengths. Ironically, Reisen is also depicted as one of the more level-headed characters of the series. Doujins make fun of her danmaku, which vaguely resemble suppositories, as well as her rabbit ears, which look as though they were buttoned onto her head. In [[Urban Legend in Limbo]], her urban legend was the [[Kune-kune]].
 
h4. Appearance
* !post #7885194: Usual Appearance
* !post #2789206: [[Urban Legend in Limbo]]
* !post #2475808: [[Forbidden Scrollery]]

She has [[red eyes]], [[rabbit ears]] and a [[rabbit tail]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]]. She is one of the few Touhou characters with a "normal" outfit, with a [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]] over a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] [[collared shirt|with]] a [[red necktie]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[pink skirt]], [[white socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. There might be a [[crescent pin]] or a [[carrot pin]] somewhere on her clothing. 

h4. External links
* "Touhou Wiki: Reisen Udongein Inaba":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Reisen_Udongein_Inaba
other_names: 鈴仙・優曇華院・イナバ

title: higashi_no_eden
body:
An anime series that premiered in 2009.

On November 22, 2010, ten missiles struck uninhabited areas of Japan, claiming no victims. This apparent terrorist act is referred to as "Careless Monday" and disregarded by most people. The series begins three months later, with a young Japanese woman named [[Morimi Saki]] visiting Washington D.C. as part of her graduation trip. When she gets into trouble, a mysterious Japanese man, who introduces himself as [[Takizawa Akira]], helps her through it. The man appears to have no memory and is completely naked, carrying only a gun and a cell phone charged with 8.2 billion yen in digital money.

h4. External links

* "Anime News Network: Higashi no Eden":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/encyclopedia/anime.php?id=10474
* "My Anime List: Higashi no Eden":https://myanimelist.net/anime/5630/Higashi_no_Eden

title: world_of_warships
body:
A multiplayer naval combat game developed by Wargaming. Featuring [[World War I]] ironclads, [[World War II]] ships and Fictional/Prototype ships that were never been made into steel or design only. This game also features Superships, these ships are created or designed during 1945 with advanced technology, surpassing warships from the second world war.

Notably, it's collaborated with [[Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio]], [[High School Fleet]], [[Azur Lane]] and [[Blue Archive]]. Azur Lane in particular further partners with WoWs to receive inspiration for its annual Priority Research ship series.

h4. Ships unique to World of Warships
[tn]Sorted by appearance order[/tn]
* [[Amagi (World of Warships)|]] (0.1.5)
* [[Myogi (World of Warships)|]] (0.2.1)

title: alcremie
body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0869 in the National Pokédex, a Fairy-type.

Evolves from [[Milcery]]. It has 63 unique forms, each with a different combination of [[cream]] (body coloration) and [[sweets|sweet]] (head decorations). It also has a [[Gigantamax]] form; its appearance is the same for every Alcremie, regardless of its initial form.

Japanese name: [b]Mawhip[/b]

* !post #3560905: Alcremie ([[Alcremie (Vanilla Cream)|Vanilla Cream]] + [[Alcremie (Strawberry Sweet)|Strawberry Sweet]])

h6. Types of cream

title: donut
body:
A small, fried pastry usually glazed with various frostings and often with filling insides. Also known as a "doughnut".

The donut's most common form, a ring-shaped bun, was a modern creation. This tag can also be applied to various donuts in other shapes, including the traditional rounded donuts.

In media, particularly American ones, donut is stereotypically associated with the [[police]]. This cliché originated from the interwar period of the US, in which donuts were the only food that was almost always readily available during late night or early morning shift.

h4. Types

* [[chocolate donut]]
* [[French cruller]]
* [[old-fashioned donut]]
* [[Pon de Ring]]

h4.See also

* [[bagel]]
* [[donut innertube]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: zombie_(minecraft)
body:
A hostile mob in [[Minecraft]]. [[Undead]], green humanoid creatures who dress in a [[blue shirt]] and [[blue_pants|pants]], similarly to the player character in Minecraft, [[Steve (minecraft)|]].

Zombies spawn in the dark and ignite when in sunlight. Originally, zombies could be slain and reward the player with [[feathers]], but zombies no longer drop feathers, and instead drop rotten flesh, [[steel ingot|iron ingot]], [[carrot|carrots]], and [[potato|potatoes]], or few chance of dropping any tools they hold.

Appears in [i][[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]][/i] as an alternate skin for Steve.

h4. See also

* [[Husk (minecraft)|]]
* [[Zombified Piglin]]
* [[Zombie Villager (minecraft)|]]

title: enderman
body:
A neutral mob in [[Minecraft]], native to [[the end (minecraft)|The End]] while being able to spawn in all three dimensions. Endermen are tall black humanoids with elongated limbs, and purple eyes. Noted for their ability to pick up and move certain blocks such as dirt and flowers, disrupting a player's constructions. 

While being stared, Endermen will freeze in place and begin shaking before using [[teleportation]] to attack the player.  They will then teleport to the player and attack once the player looks away.  They have been compared to a [[Weeping Angel]] in this respect, though they do not remain motionless when in visual range.

Appears in [i][[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]][/i] as an alternate skin for [[Steve_(minecraft)|]].

h4. See also

* [[Ender Dragon]]
* [[List of Minecraft characters]]

h4. External links

* "Minecraft Wiki: Enderman":https://minecraft.wiki/w/Enderman

title: arl-44
body:
The [b]ARL 44[/b] was a French heavy [[tank destroyer]] whose development started just before the end of [[World War II]], after the liberation of [[France]] in 1944.

The ARL-44 bears very distinctive characteristics, with a WWI-style track system (similar to the Churchill) which runs across the whole side of its chassis. This tank is a mix of different inspirations, mainly late war German tank technology such as the [[Panther (tank)|]] series or the [[Tiger II]], from which it takes its sloped frontal armour and tall profile. 

Only sixty of these tanks were ever completed, from 1949 onwards. The type proved to be unsatisfactory and was phased out in 1953.

title: wavy_sidelocks
body:
[[Sidelocks]] that are [[wavy hair|wavy]], [i]in contrast to the rest of the hair[/i].
This is usually either because:
* the rest of the hair is naturally non-wavy, or
* a naturally wavy-haired character is wearing their [[hair up]], and the waviness is thus cancelled.

If all (or most) of a character's hair is wavy, simply use [[wavy hair]] instead.

title: washizu_mahjong
body:
A variant of [[mahjong]] invented in the [[akagi: yami ni oritatta tensai|Akagi]] manga and named after its creator, [[Washizu Iwao]], which involves a special tile set in which three out of four of each type of [[mahjong tile]] are transparent. Instead of a wall, tiles are drawn from a hidden container while the players wear [[black gloves]] to make sure they can't feel the tile. In addition, points can be paid for with [[blood]] or [[money]].

It is the centerpiece of the titular Washizu Mahjong arc of the manga, which is composed almost entirely of the mahjong game between Washizu Iwao and [[Akagi Shigeru]]. The arc lasted between 1997 to the manga's ending in 2017, making it the longest arc and the longest "battle" in manga history.

title: akagi:_yami_ni_oritatta_tensai
body:
[b]Akagi: The Genius who Descended into Darkness[/b] is a Riichi [[Mahjong]] centric manga by [[Fukumoto Nobuyuki]], and the second entry in his [[Fukumoto Mahjong|mahjong series]]. It is about the young days of [[Akagi Shigeru]] from [[Ten (manga)|]], chronicling the beginning of his rise to legend in the underworld of Mahjong in the late 1950s and early 1960s. The manga received a 26 episode anime in 2005.

Famous for the [[Washizu Mahjong]] arc, which lasted from 1997 to the manga's completion in 2017, making it the longest manga arc in history.

title: lusamine_(pokemon)
body:
Character in [[pokemon sm|Pokémon Sun and Moon]]. President of the Aether Foundation. Despite her youthful appearance, she's at least 41 years old.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] worn [[hair over one eye|over one eye]]. She wears a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[white leggings|white]] [[leggings]] and [[high heels]]. She has [[yellow nails|yellow]] [[nail polish]] and has a [[diamond_(shape)|diamond-shaped]] [[green gemstone|emerald]] on her chest.

In the game, she is [spoiler]the mother of [[Lillie_(pokemon)|]] and [[Gladion (pokemon)|]], and the true antagonist of the game.[/spoiler]

In the [[pokemon sm (anime)|Sun & Moon anime]], she is [spoiler]not an antagonist, but her overbearing demeanor and dedication to her work put her at odds with Lillie.[/spoiler]

body:
A Legendary [[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]], #0773 in the National Pokédex.

Possesses multiple forms, one of each type, accessed via the use of different [[memory_(pokemon)|Memories]] through its [[pokemon_ability|Ability]], RKS System. It is possible to distinguish which form of Silvally it is by observing its usually [[white feathers]] (characteristic of its Normal form), as they change color to match each type.

title: bare_hips
body:
Clothes that leaves the hips bare. Whether it be a [[leotard]], a [[swimsuit]], a garment that has a [[side slit]] like post #1284252 or a [[hakama]] or any garment that exposes the hips.

An example of this is [[ibuki_(street_fighter)|Ibuki]] of [[Street Fighter III (series)|Street Fighter III]] (ex: post #1282595). 

h4. See Also: 

* [[bare legs]] for when the whole leg is exposed 
* [[highleg]] for when the garment is above the hips 
* [[lowleg]] for when its below

title: skin_tight
body:
Clothing that is extremely form-fitting. 

Skin tight clothing usually leaves no space between the skin and the clothing. Common examples include [[bodysuit]]s, [[leotard]]s, [[swimsuit]]s, sportswear, and other clothing made of [[spandex]], [[latex]], or other tight stretchable materials. Often, the clothing is so tight that [[cameltoe]], [[covered nipples]], [[covered abs]], or [[covered navel]]s are visible.

See [[tight clothes]] for regular clothing that is tight, but not skin tight. See [[impossible clothes]] for clothing that is unrealistically skin tight, especially around the chest.

h4. Examples

* post #192608
* post #380992
* post #435357

h4. Related tags

* [[bodysuit]]

* [[spandex]]
* [[latex]]

* [[impossible clothes]]

title: junker_queen_(overwatch)
body:
Real name: Odessa "Dez" Stone
Age: 35-40 (approx.)
Occupation: Gladiator champion (formerly), Ruler of Junkertown
Base: Junkertown, Australia

A former wastelander, Odessa "Dez" Stone has ruled the squabbling Junker factions for over a decade. Everywhere she goes is her battlefield of choice, every seat is her throne, and everyone on the planet is her subject, whether they know it or not. Her tale of conquest is just beginning...

The Junker Queen is the uncontested ruler of the chaotic city of Junkertown. Armed with a shotgun, her knife Gracie, and her axe Carnage, she delights in wreaking havoc on the front line of battle.

VA: Leah De Niese ([[Overwatch 2]]), Siho Ellsmore/Davida McKenzie ([[Overwatch 1]]), Bianca Krahl (German)

title: eve_(master_of_the_heavenly_yard)
body:
Character featured in [[master of the heavenly yard (vocaloid)|]]. [[Adam (master of the heavenly yard)|]]'s twin sister. [spoiler]The reincarnation of [[Eve Moonlit]], born from the artificial black box womb in the [[Houtei no Nushi]]'s body. During the events of the story, she prematurely attempts a Re_birthday, causing herself, Adam, Houtei no Nushi, and [[Gammon Octo]] to be reformatted and sent to a parallel world, with the four of them reincarnating into their past selves of [[Adam Moonlit]], [[Eve Moonlit|Eve Zvezda]], [[Irina Clockworker|Maria Moonlit]], and [[Gammon Loop Octopus]].[/spoiler]

She is represented by an [[aged down]] [[Hatsune Miku]] [[kagamine rin|with]] [[blonde hair]].

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: qianlong_emperor
body:
The [b]Qianlong Emperor[/b] (25 September 1711 – 7 February 1799), also known by his temple name Emperor Gaozong of Qing, personal name Hongli, was the fifth emperor of the [[Qing dynasty]] and the fourth Qing emperor to rule over [[Chinese Empire|China proper]].

The fourth son of the Yongzheng Emperor, he reigned officially from 11 October 1735 to 8 February 1796. In 1796, he abdicated in favour of his son, the Jiaqing Emperor, out of filial piety towards his grandfather, the Kangxi Emperor, who ruled for 61 years, so that he would not officially usurp him as the longest-reigning emperor. Despite his retirement, however, the Qianlong Emperor retained ultimate power as the Emperor Emeritus until his death in 1799, making him one of the longest-reigning monarchs in history as well as one of the longest-lived, dying at age eighty-seven. During his lifetime, he was given the deified title "Emperor Manjushri" by the Qing's Tibetan subjects.

title: sampo_koski
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Hirakawa Daisuke]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[blue hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaked ends]], and a [[muscular]] build. His default outfit consists of a [[black shirt]], [[red jacket|red]] [[cropped jacket]], [[black gloves]], single [[shoulder armor]] on his right side, [[black pants]], and [[brown footwear|brown shoes]]. 

He makes a suprise appreance in [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] as an enemy boss for the game's HSR collaboration event.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7689999: Splash art
* !post #7732642: Eyes of the Prey (signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
A silver-tongued salesman, where there is profit to be made, you can be sure Sampo is nearby.

Sampo's unique knowledge makes it hard not to approach him for help, but becoming his "customer" is not necessarily a good thing.

After all, "customers" can quickly turn into "commodities" for the right price.
[/expand]

title: terry_crews
body:
Terry Alan Crews (born July 30, 1968) is an American actor, television host, and former football player. He played [[Julius Rock]] in the UPN/CW sitcom [[Everybody Hates Chris]], which aired from 2005 to 2009, and portrayed [[Terry Jeffords]] in the Fox and NBC sitcom [[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]] (2013–2021). Crews starred in the BET reality series [[The Family Crews]] (2010–2011), and hosted the U.S. version of the game show [[Who Wants to Be a Millionaire]] from 2014 to 2015. He has appeared in films, including [[Friday After Next]] (2002), [[White Chicks]] (2004), [[Idiocracy]] (2006), [[Blended]] (2014), the [[Expendables]] series (2010–2014), and [[Rumble]] (2021). Crews began hosting [[America's Got Talent]] in 2019, following his involvement in the same role for the program's spin-off series [[America's Got Talent: The Champions]].
He also was the star of a famous advertising campaign with [[Old Spice]] body spray.

title: goshiki_agiri
body:
[b]Goshiki Agiri[/b] is the main character from [[Kill Me Baby]].

She is a ninja assassin from the same organization as [[Sonya_(kill_me_baby)|]] and uses various stereotypical yet comically bizarre ninja techniques, such as her "having-your-hair-stay-up-even-when-you-are-upside-down" jutsu. She also carry various "ninja tools" and have everything from bazookas to machine guns somehow hidden under her shirt.

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]], with a rather [[large breasts]] for her age.

She is voiced by [[Takabe Ai]] in the anime and by [[Shinoda Minami]] in [i][[Kirara Fantasia]][/i].

title: e-girl
body:
Western alternative fashion trend that emerged in the late 2010s and began to pick up in popularity in the 2020s. Its origins are derived from [[emo fashion]], [[scene fashion]] and [[streetwear]]. It is associated with social media and Internet culture, and sexuality.

The fashion often consists of baggy clothing, mesh, [[chain]]s and [[padlock]]s, [[crop top]]s, [[choker]]s, [[beanie]]s and [[bucket hat]]s, and [[platform footwear]]. Hair is often dyed in two colors, either [[split-color hair]] or [[colored inner hair]], with one of the colors usually being black or a dark brown. Heavy makeup, particularly [[eyeliner]], is also common, and black heart stickers are commonly worn on the cheek.

h4. See also

* [[tag group:fashion style]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: E-kid":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E-kid
* "Aesthetics Wiki: E-Girl":https://aesthetics.fandom.com/wiki/E-Girl

title: graphics_card
body:
A video card (also called a graphics card or GPU) is a [[computer]] component that generates video output for a computer [[monitor]].

Video cards are normally used to generate 3D graphics in gaming. In recent years video cards have also been increasingly used for AI training and cryptocurrency mining.

h4. Types

h6. [[AMD]]

* [[Radeon VII]]
* [[Radeon 7200]]
* [[Radeon RX 9070 XT]]

h6. [[Nvidia]]

* [[GeForce GTX 480]]
* [[GeForce GTX 690]]
* [[GeForce GTX 980]]
* [[GeForce GTX 1030]]

title: nvidia
body:
[b]Nvidia Corporation[/b] (/ɪnˈvɪdiə/ [i]in-VID-eeə[/i]) (commonly referred to as [b]Nvidia[/b], stylized as [b]NVIDIA[/b], [b]nVIDIA[/b] or [b]nVidia[/b]) is an American worldwide technology company based in Santa Clara, California. Nvidia manufactures graphics processing units (GPUs), as well as system-on-a-chip units (SOCs) for the mobile computing market. Nvidia's primary GPU product line, labeled "GeForce", is in direct competition with [[AMD]]'s "Radeon" products.

Colloquially referred to as "Team Green."

title: geforce_rtx_5090
body:
The GeForce RTX 5090 is [[Nvidia]]'s top of the line [[graphics card]] belonging to the RTX 50 series line and was released January 30, 2025.

Reception amongst reviewers have been positive on it's performance, though general reception has been mired by issues such as it's increased price tag compared to it's predecessor the [[GeForce RTX 4090]], extremely limited stock upon release, price increases after the US raised tariffs on Chinese goods on February 1, 2025, hardware issues related to it's power connector and internal power distribution system, hardware defects impacting some consumers, and buggier than normal software.

title: geforce_rtx_5080
body:
The GeForce RTX 5080 is a high-end [[graphics card]] belonging to [[Nvidia]]'s RTX 50 series line and was released January 30, 2025.  It is the second best performing GPU in the line, behind the [[GeForce RTX 5090]] card.

Reception has been somewhat lackluster, particularly by reviewers, due to a lack of significant performance gains from it's predecessor the GeForce RTX 4080 Super.  Additionally miring it's reception has been it's limited availability on release, price increases after the US raised tariffs on Chinese goods on February 1, 2025, hardware issues involving it's power cable, hardware defects in some units, and buggier than normal software.

title: radeon_rx_9070_xt
body:
The [[Radeon]] RX 9070 XT is [[AMD]]'s flagship from the Radeon RX 9000 series line of [[graphics card]]s and was released March 6, 2025.  AMD opted to not compete against [[Nvidia]] in the high-end graphics card market with the 9000 series, instead focusing on the mid-tier and lower markets.  The 9070 XT as such is comparable to Nvidia's RTX 4070 Ti and RTX 5070 Ti GPUs, especially in rasterization performance.  Going along with this change in focus was AMD's naming change from previous Radeon RX series, making the naming scheme similar to Nvidia's so people could more readily compare equivalents.

General reception of the RX 9070 XT has been positive, particularly amongst reviewers, though there has been anger at what appears to be a fake MSRP of $600 as there have been indications, though denied by AMD, that this is only a temporary price for the launch with the prices afterwards to go up.  A lot of expectations have been placed on this GPU, as various issues with availability, pricing, and tech issues for Nvidia's RTX 50-series has driven interest for an affordable alternative to Nvidia's cards.

title: mickey_17_(film)
body: Mickey 17 is a 2025 science fiction black comedy film written, produced, and directed by Bong Joon-ho, based on the 2022 novel Mickey7 by Edward Ashton. The film stars [[Robert Pattinson]] in the title role, alongside Naomi Ackie, Steven Yeun, Toni Collette, and Mark Ruffalo. Set in the future, the plot follows a man who joins a space colony as an "Expendable", a disposable worker who gets cloned every time he dies for research purposes.

title: radeon_vii
body:
The Radeon VII is a [[graphics card]] produced by [[AMD]] and was released in early 2019.  It was the first GPU released by AMD produced using TSMC's 7nm process.  Unlike the later 2019 released AMD RX 5700 and RX 5700 XT video cards that were based on the new RDNA microarchitecture, the Radeon VII was based on the older Graphics Core Next 5 microarchitecture.  It featured 16gb of HBM2 memory, as opposed to the more conventional and cheaper GDDR6 memory.  Reviews of the Radeon VII frequently made note that it had good performance, but that it performed weaker to Nvidia's equally priced RTX 2080, particularly in gaming.  Reviews also considered the GPU to be power hungry and the cooling solution extremely loud under load.

While it was released in February of 2019, production of it was stopped entirely only 5 months later with the release of the RX 5700 and RX 5700 XT GPUs.  It is believed that this was due to the high cost in manufacturing the Radeon VII, so instead of scaling down production with the release of the newer cards it was simpler to end production entirely.

title: sasaki_to_p-chan
body:
Sasaki to P-chan (EN Title: Sasaki and Peeps) is a Japanese light novel series written by Buncololi and illustrated by [[Kantoku]]. It was originally published as a web novel. A TV anime adaptation was announced in the works in July 2022.

The series is a fantasy comedy revolving around the titular [[Sasaki (sasaki to p-chan)|]], a 39-year-old salary man, who one day purchases a Java sparrow for companionship. Upon bringing the bird home to his six-tatami mat sized apartment, the bird talks to him and identifies himself as Piercarlo the Starsage from another world. Thus begins Sasaki's hectic life of traveling to and from a fantasy world, getting pulled in to a secret conflict involving psychics, encountering dangerous magical girls, and getting caught in the middle of a death game battle between angels and demons.

title: akita_neru
body:
Akita Neru is a [[Vocaloid]] Derivative. Her name ([b]亞北ネル[/b] - [i]Akita. Neru[/i]), in phonetic reading, sounds like "I quit. Going to sleep."

She started out as a meme on 2channel, where a troll user started threadcrapping all Vocaloid related threads. Some user commented that he wouldn't get angry only if the troll was a cute girl. Thus Akita Neru, a tsundere non-Vocaloid net-chara was born. Her image color is orange-ish yellow and her character item is a cell phone. Her design was created by [[Smith Hioka|Smith Hioka (スミス･ヒオカ)]] in 2007. Neru is sometimes written as a Miku wannabe, others as the anti-hero of the Vocaloid personage. She has been officially recognized as a [[Hatsune Miku|Miku]] derivative by Crypton since 2008, and most vocal representations of Neru uses Miku's voicebank (though some producers use Rin's voicebank, ala NanameueP, and some fans use the phone noises from Triple Baka).

In the West, she's largely remembered for her appearance in [[Triple Baka (Vocaloid)|]]. She would once more return to prominence in 2024 as a result of a meme relating to [[Mesmerizer (Vocaloid)|]], due to a reply to a tweet reminiscing about Triple Baka, where Neru was called ""the yellow one that doesn't appear in Mesmerizer":[https://twitter.com/FailedDumbFuck/status/1800938120416010623]". The wave of Neru fanart that followed would culminate in [[SWAGAMICCHI]]'s fan design for what Neru "could've looked like ":[/posts/7736166] in Mesmerizer.

h4. See also

* [[Akita Neru (Ethnic)]]: [[Project Diva]] module
* [[Akine Haru]]: fusion with fellow Miku derivative [[Yowane Haku]]
* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]
* [[Akita Nero]]: younger brother

h4. External links

* "Vocaloid Wikia":[http://vocaloid.wikia.com/wiki/Akita_Neru#History]
* "KnowYourMeme":[http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/akita-neru]

title: yowane_haku
body:
[b]Yowane Haku[/b] is an [[original]] [[Vocaloid]] character originated from a [[2channel]] thread where a user commented: [i]"I bought [[Hatsune Miku]] for her cute looks but no matter how hard I try, I can't get anything better than mechanical sounding songs out of her."[/i]

An artist ([[Caffein]]) took this idea and ran with it to create Yowane Haku, an alter ego of all unskilled users of Hatsune Miku. Haku is a sad Vocaloid who just can't sing as well as Miku. She is always crying because of this and vents her frustration by drinking. Her image colors are silver and purple. Her character item is a sake bottle. She's also noted for her [[large breasts|curvier figure]] compared to Miku and has a decent following. Haku's name means "speaking weak words" ('speaking' here has connotation of a pent-up sigh or muttering.)

This created a trend of users labeling badly-made Vocaloid songs with voyakiloid, or "shouting vocaloid." It is implied that it was Haku who sung those songs, and not Miku. Later on, she received several fan-made [[mikumikudance|MMD]] models and being treated as a "genuine" character rather than a byword for bad Vocaloid songs.

Her usual attire consists of a [[crop top|cropped]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[grey shirt]] with a [[purple necktie]], [[black pants]] with a [[purple belt]] tied around them, [[detached sleeves]], and a [[striped bow]].

h4. See also

* [[Yowaneko]]
* [[Honne Dell]]
* [[Akine Haru]]

title: arcana_trust
body:
Character from [[Shinrabanshou]]'s 2012 storyline, Daimaou to Yattsu no Pillar. A demon of the Vice clan and loyal familiar of former demon lord [[Ark Mateus]], sometimes nicknamed Arca (アルカ). She is in love with Ark, but briefly turns on him out of jealousy when she feels he is prioritizing humans over demons.

Arcana returns in the 2013 storyline, Kuja Senran, where her body is transformed into that of a child after she gives up half her magic power to save Ark's life.

title: izuna_(shinrabanshou)
body:
A character in [[Shinrabanshou]]. Izuna is a [[kyuubi]] fox spirit introduced in the 2010 storyline Zex Factor as the "beast soul" partner of the main character, [[Homura Kai]]. She reappears in a weakened form in following year's story, Shichiten no Hasha, as the mother of the new main character, [[Sai (shinrabanshou)|]].

Izuna wears a [[miko]] dress and has two forms: her initial beast soul form, with a small [[chibi]]-like body and gray hair, and her true form, with an adult body and blonde hair. After she regains her true form, her beast soul body also features blonde hair.

title: ariana_grande
body:
A famous American singer. She has had many hit songs, including "Problem," "Break Free," "Thank U, Next," "7 Rings," "Into You," and "Positions." 

Her career was initially launched with her as an actress, her first major role being [[Cat Valentine]] in [[Nickelodeon]]'s [[Victorious]].

She appears in [[Final Fantasy Brave Exvius]] as a collab character in various guises, and is also a playable character skin in [[Fortnite]].

Her most recent role is in the film adaptation of Wicked as Galinda "Glinda" Upland.

title: toho_jackal_(racehorse)
body: Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Special Week (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Toho Gaia. He is famous for winning and shattering the record at the 2014 Kikuka Sho and infamous for being the instigator of [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]]'s late start at the 2015 Takarazuka Kinen. He is also Special Week's only progeny to become a stallion in any capacity.

title: amekaji_gyaru
body:
A substyle of [[gyaru]] based around "American casual" fashion. It takes inspiration from American [[streetwear]] from the past few decades, particularly [[1980s fashion|1980s]], [[1990s fashion|1990s]], and [[Y2K fashion]].

Common elements of the style include brightly colored clothing, [[print shirt|graphic tees]], patterns, [[denim]], [[baseball cap]]s and [[beanie]]s, [[belt]]s, plastic jewelry, and [[bangle]]s.

h4. See also

* [[hadeko]]
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

title: y2k_fashion
body:
A [[fashion]] style based on the style trends of the late '90s and early 2000s, the cusp of the new millennium - as well as 2000s retrofuturism. The modern Y2K fashion revival has been spearheaded by musical acts such as [[PinkPantheress]] and certain [[k-pop]] girl groups - most notably [[NewJeans]].

Clothing often uses shiny materials, [[fur]], and [[denim]], and may be decorated with sequins or [[rhinestone]]s. [[Leopard print]] and [[camouflage]] are common, as well as imagery of butterflies, stars, and hearts.

Common garments include [[tube top]]s and cropped [[tank top]]s and big [[jacket]]s on the upper body, and oversized pants such as [[cargo pants]] or [[bell-bottoms]], denim shorts and skirts, or [[miniskirt]]s in bright colors on the lower body. Bottomwear often has a low-rise waistline. Common accessories include [[sunglasses]], [[belt]]s with heart-shaped or jeweled buckles, [[leg warmers|leg]] and [[arm warmers]], fluffy [[hat]]s, and [[handbag]]s. Footwear commonly worn includes [[fur-trimmed boots]], and [[platform footwear]].

It may sometimes overlap with [[cyber fashion]], [[gyaru]], [[streetwear]] and [[heisei retro]]. Additionally, it can overlap with [[1990s fashion]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7928623
* !post #8232179

h4. See also

* [[2000s (style)]]
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

title: 1990s_fashion
body:
[[Fashion]] based on the popuar styles of the 1990s. Frequently features [[cargo pants]], [[baseball cap]]s, [[jeans]], [[tube top]]s, [[baggy clothes]], [[tie-dye]], and heavy influence from [[hip hop]] and [[punk]] fashion.

More likely to overlap with [[Y2K fashion]] than it is with [[1980s fashion]].

h4. See also

* [[1990s (style)]]
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

title: poang_armchair
body:
[i]Because of technical limitations, the tag is 'poang armchair' instead of 'poäng armchair'[/i]

The POÄNG armchair is a piece of furniture from [[IKEA]], designed by Noboru Nakamura in collaboration with Lars Engman. Originally introduced in 1976 as the "Poem" chair, it was renamed "POÄNG" in 1992. 
A notable design feature of this chair is its bentwood frame giving the chair a floaty look and a slight springy feel when sat upon.

h4. Photo
* !asset #25160950

h4. External Links
* "Ikea.com: POÄNG Series":[https://www.ikea.com/us/en/search/?q=PO%C3%84NG]
