title: nonhuman_humanoid
body:
For characters that don't fit under [[no_humans]] but would not be considered human either.
This tag is also for those that don't fit under any specific racial tag(s).

Additionally if the character is clearly not human, but you don't know if there is one or a correct racial tag, this tag should be applied.

This tag should not be applied to posts with a clearly defined racial tag. unless there is an additional character in the same post that fall under these guidelines.

h4.See also

[[tag group: species (male)]]
[[no_humans]]

title: the_monkey
body:
The Monkey is a novelty [[dancing|dance]], most popular in 1963. The dance was popularized by two R&B records: Major Lance's "The Monkey Time", and The Miracles' "Mickey's Monkey", both released during the summer of 1963.

Characters in the anime series [[Overman King Gainer]] do the monkey in the [[King Gainer Over!|opening animation]] and in the show itself. It is also featured in the [[Johnny Bravo (series)|]] cartoon series.

h4. See also

* [[dancing]]
* [[Hanamaru Sensation]]
* [[tag group:dances]]

h4. External links

title: chocobo
body:
Trademark steed of the [[Final Fantasy]] JRPG series by [[Square Enix]] (formerly Squaresoft).

They are large birds resembling some cross between a [[chicken]] and an [[ostrich]] or other [[ratite]]. Often used as mounts (in the abscence of [[horse]]s). Primarily yellow, though other colors (and sizes) are known. They make "kweh" and "wark" noises. Baby chocobos are "[[chicobo]]s" ("ko-chocobos" in Japan). In most games, they are flightless, but other games gave them the ability to fly and swim.

A chibi version heads up the [[Final Fantasy Fables]]/[[Chocobo (series)|]] series.

h4. See also

* [[Chocobo costume]]

title: e-102_gamma
body:
One of the playable characters in [[Sonic Adventure]]. The second of the E-100 Series of robots created by [[Dr. Eggman]]. A predominantly red [[robot]] that wields an [[arm cannon]], with the number 102 printed in his body.

Gamma would work in the Egg Carrier along with his fellow robots under orders from Eggman. However, a few interactions with [[Amy Rose]] and the [[flicky_(character)|Flicky]] she took care of prompted him to develop free will and to identify his creator as an enemy. Gamma then assigns himself the mission of saving his brothers from control by destroying their robotic exterior and freeing the animals that power them: [[E-103 Delta]], [[E-104 Epsilon]], [[E-105 Zeta]], and [[E-101 Beta]]. [spoiler]This also includes his own destruction.[/spoiler]

body:

It is used to take care of [[Chao (sonic)|]] on the go using the [[Game Boy Advance]], and can connect to the GameCube games to transfer Chao to and from Tiny Chao Garden.

[[Knuckles Chao]], [[Amy Chao]] and [[Tails Chao]] can only be obtained through a special promotional version of the Tiny Chao Garden.

title: hk416_(moonlit_devotion)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An [[alternate costume]] for [[Girls' Frontline]]'s [[HK416 (girls' frontline)|]], appearing first on the cover of the Japanese-exclusive Dolls' Frontline Official Skin Collection artbook from 2020. Illustrated by [[Imoko (imonatsuki)|]], it is a concept design for what HK416's [[wedding dress]] skin might look like. It never received an official release as a skin, but it did receive a release as a figurine, which granted the dress its name (以月伝心).

HK416 wouldn't get an official wedding dress skin until 2024, in the form of [[HK416 (Transparent Blue) (girls' frontline)|Transparent Blue]].

title: kemono_friends
body:
A Japanese multimedia franchise about the fictional [i]Japari Park[/i], where various animals—both real and mythological— have been [[personification|anthropomorphized]] into animal girls, referred to as [i]Friends[/i], by the mysterious power of a curious substance called [[Sandstar]].

Originally envisioned as a multimedia project, a mobile game published by [[Nexon]] was released in 2015, with a tie-in anime series set after the events of the game due to air some time later. The project was not without its turbulence, as the mobile game ended its services in late 2016—just one month before the anime aired in early 2017, the first season of which was financially restricted, resulting in poor animation quality and mixed reviews from initial critics and viewers.

Despite the 2015 game being closed down early—thus failing to give anime viewers context as had been planned—the anime was a surprise hit, due in no small part to scripting by director [[tatsuki (irodori)|Tatsuki]]; the show received very high ratings and viewership, miraculously reviving the dying franchise into a breakout success.

In 2017, Nexon sold the [i]Kemono Friends[/i] franchise to [[Kadokawa]] who held the right of the franchise ever since.

h4. Media under the franchise

h6. Anime

* TV anime series [i]Kemono Friends[/i] by [[yaoyorozu_(studio)|Yaoyorozu]] (Winter 2017)
* TV anime series [i][[Kemono Friends 2]][/i] by Tomason (Winter 2019)
* Original net anime [i]Welcome to the JAPARI PARK[/i] (2018-2020)

h6. Game

* Mobile RPG [i]Kemono Friends[/i] by [[Nexon]] (2015-2016)
* Mobile game [i][[Kemono Friends Pavilion]][/i] by Bushimo (2018-2021)

title: marine_the_raccoon
body:
A supporting character in the [[Sonic (series)|]] series.
She is a cheerful but often reckless [[raccoon]] girl who befriended [[Sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]] and [[Tails (sonic)|]] after they crash-landed in the Sol Dimension at the beginning of [[Sonic Rush Adventure]]. She speaks with an exaggerated Australian accent.
H4. External Links
* "Sonic Wiki":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Marine_the_Raccoon
other_names: マリン・ザ・ラクーン

title: victorian
body:
Posts that pertain to, or are inspired by, elements of [[United Kingdom|England]]'s Victorian Era (1837-1901). Preceded by the [[Georgian]] and [[Regency era]]s, and followed by the Edwardian and the modern pre-Elizabethian eras.

h4. Examples

* !post #357624
* !post #426632
* !post #465206
* !post #1111077
* !post #8462102
* !post #7658861

h4. See also

* [[Aristocratic clothes]]
* [[Classic lolita]]
* [[Gothic lolita]]
* [[Ouji fashion]]
* [[Victorian maid]]
* [[Alternate universe]]
* [[Steampunk]]
* [[tag group:fashion style]]

A symbol drawn next to a character's head to represent [[laughing|laughter]], mirth, happiness or chatting noise. Looks a bit like ╀─╀, but with a curved line. Commonly used for laughter or the noise of a crowd that happens in the background, or in a scene that is otherwise silent.

Not to be confused with the "Chinese radical":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radical_(Chinese_characters)] ""艹":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/艹]", which is often used as a shorter and more euphemistic form of ""cao":[https://dictionary.hantrainerpro.com/chinese-english/translation-cao_fuck.htm]" (Chinese for "fuck") when typing/writing.

h4. Examples

* !post #1729034
* !post #2011066
* !post #2016353
* !post #4248356

h4. See also

* [[^^^]]
* [[notice lines]]
* [[shout lines]]
* [[squeans]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

title: mew_(pokemon)
body:
A Psychic-type Mythical [[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]], #0151 in the National Pokédex.

A primordial Pokémon with the DNA of every Pokémon species within in it. It is a small, pink [[cat|feline]] with [[blue eyes]] and a long, whip-like tail. It is the basis for [[Mewtwo]], a larger, malicious [[clone]].

Japanese name: [b]Mew[/b]

title: su_(honkai_impact)
body:
A [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] character. One of the [[Thirteen Flame-Chasers (honkai impact)|]], codenamed [b]Bodhi[/b], voiced by [[Sakurai Takahiro]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] tied to a [[low ponytail]], and [[purple eyes]]. His default outfit consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[polo shirt]] with a white cloth piece to his left, [[black pants]], [[black footwear]], and [[black gloves]]. 

On account of his profession as a scientist, he is also portrayed with a [[lab coat]]. 

h4. Skins

* !post #4827361: Default
* !post #7965751: Summer 2024

h4. See also

* [[Anaxa (honkai: star rail)|]] - his [[Honkai: Star Rail]] counterpart.
* [[Alhaitham (Genshin Impact)|]] - his [[Genshin Impact]] counterpart.

title: seiyuu_radio_no_uraomote
body:
A light novel by Nigatsu Kou (二月 公), with illustrations by [[tsukana (saba mizore)|saba mizore]] (さばみぞれ). The newbie voice actor, [[Satou Yumiko]], has trouble getting by. One day, she gets an offer to host a web radio show together with another voice actor. But she could never imagine that the other voice actor would be a famous one, and on top of that, her gloomy classmate...
An anime adaption aired in 2024.

h4. Characters
* [[Satou Yumiko]] ([[Utatane Yasumi]])
* [[Watanabe Chika]] ([[Yuugure Yuuhi]])
* [[Yubisaki Mekuru]] (Fujii Anna)
* [[Sakuranamiki Otome]]
* [[Asaka Mirei]]

h4. External links

title: mindscape_cinema_(zenless_zone_zero)
body:
A game mechanic in [[Zenless Zone Zero]] that provides succeeding upgrades to playable characters. 

It typically features an illustration that changes with each upgrade. By the third upgrade, the illustration will be fully colored, and with each subsequent upgrade, the outfit depicted will change — with a few exceptions.

h4. See also
* [[all-out attack]] - a visually similar effect from [[Persona]]

h4. External links
* "Zenless Zone Zero Wiki - Mindscape Cinema":https://zenless-zone-zero.fandom.com/wiki/Mindscape_Cinema

title: meowth
body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0052 in the National Pokédex, a Normal-type.

A [[cat]]-like Pokémon that stands on two legs. It has light [[yellow fur]] with brown accents, and has a [[koban_(gold)|]] [[coin]] on its head. 

The best known Meowth is the one who accompanies [[Team Rocket]] duo [[Jessie (pokemon)|]] and [[James (pokemon)|]] because of its ability to talk and converse in human speech.

Evolves from [[Persian_(pokemon)|]]. It also has a [[Gigantamax]] form.

Japanese name: [b]Nyarth[/b]

title: lapras
body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0131 in the National Pokédex, a Water/Ice-type.

Lapras is a blue [[plesiosaur]]id Pokémon with a hard grey shell on its back. Known for its unusually friendly altitude towards humans compared to other Pokémon. As such, it is frequently used as a [[riding_pokemon|mode of transport]] between water bodies in the Pokémon world.

It has a [[Gigantamax]] form.

Japanese name: [b]Laplace[/b]

title: azhdaha_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character in [[Genshin Impact]].

A quadrupedal rock dragon known as the Sealed Lord of Vishaps. He is a large, brown and orange dragon, with two curved horns on his head, spines running down his back, and his tail ends in tree branches.

He has two humanoid forms or avatars, which he himself describes as his "Yin and Yang": [[Jiu (genshin impact)|]], a little girl who embodies Azhdaha's anger towards Morax and the people of Liyue, and [[Kun Jun (genshin impact)|]], who represents his benevolent side.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8973071

title: dvalin_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character in [[Genshin Impact]].

Dvalin, also referred to as Stormterror, is a giant blue and turquoise dragon with six wings and two horns on its head. Dvalin has deep ties with Mondstadt and the Anemo Archon, once acting as one of Mondstadt's primary guardians.

Early in the story, two purple spikes are present on the back of Dvalin's neck. [spoiler]These spikes are the corrupted blood of the dragon [[durin (genshin impact)|Durin]], who Dvalin defeated hundreds of years ago. These spikes are removed by the player in the first arc of the game.[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

* !post #8973031

title: pp-19_bizon
body:
The [b]PP-19 Bizon[/b] (ПП-19 «Бизон»)is a Russian [[submachine gun]] designed in the early 1990s by Victor Kalashnikov (son of Mikhail Kalashnikov). The design is based on the [[AKS-74]], while sharing 60% parts commonality with it despite being [b]blowback[/b] instead of gas-operated. It uses a high-capacity (64 9×18mm Makarov [[ammunition|rounds]]) cylindrical helical [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] similar to earlier [[Calico M950]] design, but placed as a foregrip.

* !post #7162558

h4. See also

* [[PP-19 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[PP-19-01 Vityaz]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: PP-19 Bizon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PP-19_Bizon

title: ima-no-tsurugi
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. Official art by [[shikimi (yurakuru)|Shikimi]]. Voiced by [[Yamashita Daiki]].

He is (allegedly) the personal [[tantou]] of [[Minamoto no Yoshitsune]]. Dressed like a tengu as an homage to his owner having allegedly been trained by one. As he said in his introductory line, he was there from his owner's time at the temple to his very last moment. 

Has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]. He wears a [[tokin hat]] with a [[chin strap]], some sort of [[stole]]. Has a [[sode]] on his left shoulder, a [[kusazuri]] and wears [[tengu-geta]]. His [[Ima-no-tsurugi (Kiwame)|Kiwame]] form is dressed in more [[Japanese armor]], along with a bird headdress that mirrors his emotions.

Ima-no-tsurugi is a straightforward and cheerful child, treating fighting as though it's a game and boasting himself of being the fastest tantou. He has an extraordinary sense of balance and can jump about cheerfully on one-toothed geta. Despite his bonds with Minamoto no Yoshitsune, Ima-no-tsurugi is very loyal to the [[Saniwa (touken ranbu)|]], who he puts before himself. He's often seen hanging out with [[Iwatooshi]], due to their masters' shared past.  

After his Kiwame remodel, [spoiler]it's revealed he's a fictional sword and never interacted with Yoshitsune at all. Despite this, he understands that he exists because of the Saniwa, and vows to stay by their side and help them.[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "Touken Ranbu Wiki: Imanotsurugi":http://touken-ranbu.wikia.com/wiki/Imanotsurugi

title: the_legend_of_zelda_(cartoon)
body:
An American animated series based on [[The Legend of Zelda]]. It comprises thirteen episodes which first aired in North America from September 8, 1989 to December 1, 1989.

Multiple times in each episode, [[Link]] says, "Excuuuse me, Princess", in response to [[Princess Zelda|Zelda]]. The catchphrase later became a [[meme]].

title: asuna_elmarit
body:
The main protagonist of the spinoff [[Zeta Gundam]] manga [[Ecole du Ciel]] from 2001. She is also one of the franchise's few female protagonists.

[b]Asuna Elmarit[/b] is a student from [i]École du Ciel[/i], an [[Earth Federation]] military school for training future [[mobile suit]] pilots in Montréal, [[Canada]]. Unexpected events occur, exposing Asuna and her classmates to the reality that is war.

She pilots several types of mobile suits, including the [[Le Cygne]], a Gundam which became her signature mobile suit. [spoilers]As time passes Asuna gets involved first with a [[Zeon]] remnant pirate group and later in The Gryps War against the oppresive [[titans_(gundam)|Earth Federation Titans]], becoming finally a member of the [[AEUG]].[/spoilers]

Her character design resembles that of [[Takaya Noriko]] from [[Top wo Nerae!]], which also had [[Mikimoto Haruhiko]] as character designer.
other_names: アスナ・エルマリート

He takes a drastically different appearance from the other 2 designs, growing a lot larger and wearing black and purple [[armor]] with a long, [[purple cape]]. His [[orange hair|orange]] hair becomes [[spiked hair|spiky]] and his mask now has long [[red horns]] with a [[one-eyed|singular]] eye in the center.

He now wields the power of his electro [[delusion (genshin impact)|]] and hydro [[vision (genshin impact)|]] at the same time.

title: yae_miko
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

Yae Miko is the chief priest of the Grand Narukami Shrine, which she oversees and also the CEO of the namesake Yae Publishing House. She is mentioned by the [[Raiden Shogun]] when the Archon speaks of [[Zhongli (genshin impact)|]]. She is an "old friend" of Morax and Baal, and is acquainted with [[Ganyu (genshin impact)|]].

Her attire is a [[nontraditional miko]] garment, consisting of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] paired with [[detached sleeves]] and a [[red skirt]]. Despite her [[Japanese clothes]], her outfit is not a [[kimono]] and should not be tagged as one.

She is loosely based on [[Yae Sakura]] from [[honkai_impact_3rd|Honkai Impact 3rd]], another game made by miHoYo, and shares Chinese (Du Mingya) and Japanese ([[Sakura Ayane]]) voice actresses.

h4. Costumes

* !post #5019741: Default
* !post #8819886: [[Yae Miko (2nd anniversary)|2nd Anniversary]]
* !post #6696253: [[Yae Miko (autumn pop-up store)|Autumn Pop-up Store]]
* !post #8889444: [[Yae Miko (resplendent feast)|Resplendent Feast]]
